channel.title: Fritz Stelluto
channel.description: All content by Fritz Stelluto. I have been a developer and technical manager in the digital media industry since the 90s. I relocated a few years ago from London to Berlin.

item.title: OS X Apps I use
item.description:
All the OS X apps I use - for when I need to reinstall a new machine.


More...
item.dc:creator: fritz

item.title: The simplest React Loader
item.description:
When I’m messing about with React I often need a loading component as a placeholder. Here I create a simple one with no dependencies


More...
item.dc:creator: fritz

item.title: Introduction to XSS and how to mitigate it
item.description:
Cross Site Scripting (XSS) is a vulnerability which allows an attacker to run malicious code, typically javascript, in a victim’s browser or any app which can run web content.
More...
item.dc:creator: fritz

item.title: CSS Selectors in 2017
item.description:
Where are we at with Level 4 CSS Selectors in 2017? In short, nowhere. A lot of pseudo-classes were added (including the one we are all crying out for, :has) but manufacturers don’t seem interested in implementing them.


More...
item.dc:creator: fritz

item.title: Backing up a hard disk to another in OS X
item.description:
Time Machine does its own backup magic, but sometimes you just simply want two identical copies of the same hard disk. For that rsync is the way to go.


More...
item.dc:creator: fritz

item.title: Stop Chrome navigating back when swiping horizontally
item.description:
If you try to use Google Chrome on a small window on a laptop, perhaps because you are comparing two web pages side by side, swiping left or right doesn’t move the page around, but it jumps to the previous or next page. Here’s how to prevent that on OS X.


More...
item.dc:creator: fritz
